summary.Title: Plumber
summary.Presentation:
The Project
We are looking for a plumber to support us in the building of Køge University Hospital. As a plumber you will be working on a range of tasks and truly take part

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Project

We are looking for a plumber to support us in the building of Køge University Hospital. As a plumber you will be working on a range of tasks and truly take part in an extensive project.

The job will include duties such as

What we are looking for:

A plumber to join us with these characteristics:

  • Install, repair, and maintain plumbing systems, including pipes, valves, fittings, drainage systems, and fixtures (e.g., sinks, toilets, and water heaters).
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications to determine the layout of plumbing systems and materials required.
  • Assemble, install, and repair pipes, fittings, and fixtures of heating, water, and drainage systems.
  • Test plumbing systems for leaks and other issues using pressure gauges or other testing methods.
  • Identify and troubleshoot plumbing issues, providing timely and efficient solutions.
  • Collaborate with contractors and other trades to ensure plumbing systems are integrated correctly within the overall construction project.
  • Install and maintain gas piping systems and ensure safe handling of gas appliances and components.
  • Maintain and repair septic tanks, water heaters, and boilers.
  • Comply with local and state plumbing codes and regulations.
  • Use hand and power tools in a safe and effective manner.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area, ensuring all safety standards are met.

Qualifications:

  • Work experience as a plumber
  • Licensed Plumber
  • Strong understanding of plumbing systems, tools, and techniques.

What we offer:

  • Insight into a multicultural and multilingual Company;
  • Salary according to the current collective agreement;

If you think you have the right skills to be part of this great project in an exciting international environment, please do not hesitate to send us your application.

About Køge Hospital Project Team I/S (KHPT):


KHPT is a joint venture between Itinera and CMB, two Italian companies with experience in building hospitals.

The Køge Hospital Project is an expansion of the already existing University Hospital in Køge, which will include a complete renovation. When the renovation is complete, it will open to extended special departments, along with new departments for research, which will gather Zealand University Hospital under one single roof. When the work is finished the hospital will be 195.000 sq.m.
